column4: How big should a swap partition be for Ubuntu64 with 4GB of RAM?
if you have the space, use 4g swap, if not, 1-2g would be fine
hibernation would require 4g, it would dump all ram to the swap
you can still have less swap, you just have to suspend instead of hibernate
I run a lot of server machines with 5g / so 11g should be plenty
Keep in mind this isn't a server machine, I would have a GUI and everything
I install full gui on the servers so I can remote desktop, it works and it's plenty of space
64 or 32? I am talking about 64
I just dont' have the gui running on the server 24/7, I turn it off when I'm not active on that machine
I'm running 32
Do you think 64 would need more space?
I doubt it would be that big a difference
On my workstation here I am using 3.2g and I have all kinds of crap installed
what kind of laptop is it?
Gateway M-6866
scd0 would be a scsi cdrom drive, so I'm guessing your cdrom drive is on the sata controller
ah, that would explain it. Could also be my SD card slot perhaps
yeah but it's weird for an sd card to show up as scd, it would normally just be sd
Well why would a CD drive appear unallocated?
Note that I am running off the Live CD
no idea, laptop hardware is a little weird sometimes, but scd0 is a scsi cdrom device
